intro: Serrafalcus macrostachys, commonly known as the giant fern, is a striking tropical plant characterized by its large, compound leaves. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to humid regions of Southeast Asia. The plant features a robust rhizome system that supports its tall, arched fronds. Its leaves can reach lengths of over three meters, making it one of the largest fern species. Serrafalcus macrostachys thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in tropical forests.
